page.title: 17A VILLAGE MUM'S DAY - 5
page.content: At 8 p.m. I am mask making to help with our school play. I have to get a babysitter as my husband is away on a course. I leave the children safely in the hands of Kathryn, my next door neighbour and set off for the home of the producer. The mask making goes well and my cardboard box and papier mache IS looking like an owl. I hope the lad who will be wearing it will be happy. I leave Marion and Mike picking up feathers from their kitchen floor and go home at 11 o'clock. I pay the babysitter and make myself a cup of tea. The girls are cosy in their beds with their teddies at their sides. I go to bed and drink my tea - and have another five minutes to myself, like I did at the beginning of my long day early this morning. Goodnight!
